text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 2.25.3, dated August 01, 2009, is superseded.
All Operating Divisions & Functions, Web Developers, Webmasters, and Systems Administrators are required use this IRM.
Web Server Registration Procedures
page (
) This IRM describes the process for registering Intranet sites and web servers at the IRS. Registering Intranet sites and web servers ensures that is properly protected and inventoried at the IRS. (
) Purpose: This transmits revised IRM
, Intranet Site and Web Server Registration Procedures. (
) Audience: All Operating Divisions & Functions, Web Developers, and Systems Administrators are required to use this IRM. (
) Program Owner: Automation Reporting and Metrics (
) Primary Stakeholders: Information Technology (IT), Communications & Liaison (C&L). (
) Program Goals: The Web Registration System is used to register all intranet web sites and the servers they run on. (

) In order to enhance security and management of the IRS Intranet, all web and web servers residing on the IRS Intranet must be registered with Enter- prise Operations (OS:IT:EO). This requirement ensures that information residing on the IRS Intranet is properly protected and inventoried and that is not compromised. (
) ALL IRS Intranet sites and web servers are to be registered via the Operations Web Registration Database available at We

eg/Register/Default.asp . Step-by-step instructions for registering sites and web servers are provided through the process at this site. This site also contains a method to validate Intranet sites and web servers that have been registered. (

) Registration ensures that a site or server is a known entity on the Intranet, been approved for internal use by an executive level sponsor, and that a system administrator and webmaster have been designated. (

) All IRS Intranet sites and web servers are required to be registered prior to being operational by Enterprise Operations. Failure to comply with this will result in the exclusion of Intranet sites and web servers from the IRS Intranet. (
) For additional information, contact Enterprise Operations at *IT EOPSWe
e
pdate. (
) Answers to frequently asked questions and a Registration User’s Guide can found at https://webreg.web.irs.gov/We
eg/Register/Default.asp.
Site and Web Server Registration Procedures 2.25.3 page 1
Audience: All Operating Divisions & Functions, Web Developers, and Systems Administrators are required to use this IRM.
Program Goals: The Web Registration System is used to register all intranet web sites and the servers they run on.

In order to enhance security and management of the IRS Intranet, all web sites and web servers residing on the IRS Intranet must be registered with Enter- prise Operations (OS:IT:EO). This requirement ensures that information residing on the IRS Intranet is properly protected and inventoried and that data is not compromised.
2.25.3.2 (03-24-2020) Web Registration Process

ALL IRS Intranet sites and web servers are to be registered via the Enterprise Operations Web Registration Database available at https://webreg.web.irs.gov/ WebReg/Register/Default.asp . Step-by-step instructions for registering Intranet sites and web servers are provided through the process at this site. This site also contains a method to validate Intranet sites and web servers that have
Answers to frequently asked questions and a Registration User’s Guide can be found at https://webreg.web.irs.gov/WebReg/Register/Default.asp.
